item.title: Toasting History at My Son's Bar Mitzvah
item.description: Ed Shames recalls a meaningful moment at his son’s Bar Mitzvah, where a simple toast connected his family’s celebration to the powerful history he carries from his military service.

media:content.media:title: Toasting History at My Son's Bar Mitzvah
media:content.media:description: Ed Shames recalls a meaningful moment at his son’s Bar Mitzvah, where a simple toast connected his family’s celebration to the powerful history he carries from his military service.

item.title: Lying to Get Into The Marine Corps
item.description: Joseph Rodgers shares how he bent the rules to join the Marine Corps, reflecting on the motivations and determination that led him to enlist.

item.title: Flying the last combat missions in Vietnam
item.description: Graham “GT” Stevens reflects on his Army service beginning in 1968, including two combat tours and the historic final missions he flew in Vietnam just before the 1973 ceasefire.

item.title: Corpsman Earns Three Purple Hearts Saving Marines in Vietnam
item.description: A Navy corpsman recounts the bravery and sacrifice involved in saving fellow Marines during intense combat in Vietnam, actions that earned him three Purple Hearts.

item.title: Super Bowl Champion Recalls His Experience in Vietnam
item.description: Super Bowl Champion Recalls His Experience in Vietnam

item.title: The Role That Changed My Life
item.description: A Super Bowl champion looks back on his service in Vietnam, reflecting on the challenges, moments of courage, and experiences that shaped his time in the military.

item.title: Managing Air Sickness While Filming Top Gun
item.description: Commander Frank “Walleye” Weisser shares how he worked through air sickness during the filming of Top Gun: Maverick, offering a thoughtful look at the training and focus required for the role.

item.title: Super Bowl Champion Reflects on Vietnam Injury
item.description: A respectful account from a Super Bowl champion discussing his experience of being wounded during the Vietnam War, offering personal insight into service, recovery, and resilience.

item.title: A Navy SEAL’s Service Story
item.description: A respectful look at the career of a highly regarded Navy SEAL, sharing insights into training, teamwork, and service experiences without glamorizing conflict.

item.title: Inside the B-17 Crew Layout in WWII
item.description: A clear, historical look at how the B-17 bomber’s crew was organized during WWII, highlighting each position’s role and how the team worked together on missions.

item.title: Clearing a Bunker in WWII
item.description: A factual account of a WWII operation involving the challenging task of clearing an enemy-held bunker. Presented with historical context and respectful attention to the experiences of those who served.

item.title: WWII vs Modern Air Combat: Pilot Perspectives
item.description: A respectful discussion between a WWII P-51 pilot and a modern F-16 pilot as they compare how air combat, technology, and mission demands have evolved across generations.

item.title: How I Joined the Army in WWII
item.description: A respectful firsthand account of the circumstances that led to enlistment during World War II, offering historical insight into the experiences of those who served.

item.title: Stopping Panther Tanks in the Battle of the Bulge
item.description: A historical look at how Allied forces confronted German Panther tanks during the Battle of the Bulge, explaining the tactics, challenges, and impact on the wider WWII campaign.

item.title: A Life-Saving 14-Hour Medical Effort
item.description: A patient reflects on an intense 14-hour medical procedure supported by a large team of doctors and nurses, highlighting their skill, teamwork, and dedication to saving a life.

item.title: The Vital Role of Dustoff Pilots in Vietnam
item.description: A look at the crucial work of Dustoff pilots in Vietnam, highlighting their medical evacuations, dedication, and impact on saving countless lives during the conflict.

item.title: Navy Pilot’s Years of Captivity and Survival
item.description: The story of a Navy pilot who endured 2,675 days in captivity, reflecting on resilience, service, and the challenges faced during this difficult chapter in military history.

item.title: Honoring America’s Rosie the Riveters
item.description: At the 2025 American Valor Conference, Rosie the Riveters are recognized for their vital WWII contributions, celebrating the women who helped build the equipment that powered the Allied victory.

item.title: We Crash-landed and then Went to a Nightclub
item.description: A wild story that jumps from a chaotic crash-landing straight into an unforgettable night out.

item.title: WWII Veteran Ed Miklavcic joined the Air Force in 1940, when he was 20 years old, and he served his country from the beginning of the war to the end.
item.description: A moving tribute to Ed Miklavcic’s lifelong service, following his journey through the entire span of World War II.
